# Column 16 (364-374) {-}

## Esna 364 {-}

- Location: Column 16
- Date: Domitian 
- [Hieroglyphic Text](https://www.ifao.egnet.net/uploads/publications/enligne/Temples-Esna003.pdf#page=371){target="_blank"}

<div class="col2">  

^A^ *nsw.t-bỉty  *  
*nṯr šps  *  
*wr.tw r nṯr.w  *  
*ḥtp m ḥw.t-ẖnmw  *  
*ḥr qdỉ ḥr nḥp  *  
   
*ỉt zȝ.w-n=sn  *  
*ỉr nn r-ȝw  *  
*ẖnmw-Rʿ nb tȝ-sn.t   *  

^A^ The King of Upper and Lower Egypt,  
the august god,  
greatest of the gods,  
who rests within the Temple of Khnum,  
building upon the potter's wheel.  
  
Father of the guardian deities,  
who made all this in its entirety:  
Khnum-Re[^fn-364-1] Lord of Esna. 

</div>

[^fn-364-1]: ![](./images/364_A.png){width=20%} - This example suggests the radiant sundisk hieroglyph, which occurs so frequently in Khnum's name, is to be read *ẖ* < *š* < *šww*, "sun" (@sauneron-8, p. 145, Nos. 159-160), rather than *ẖ* < *ḫ* < *ȝḫ*, "bright" (@sauneron-8, p. 160, No. 225). The pair of eyes in this orthography reoccur twice with regular values in the symmetric inscription [Esna 364], B.

<div class="col2">  

^B^ *nsw.t-bỉty  *  
*ḫʿỉ m sšn   *  
*sḥḏ ỉr.ty n nṯr.w rmṯ  *  
*ṯḥn ỉnm=sn  *  
*snfr ỉb=sn  *  
*ḥr nb ḥʿʿ.tw r mȝȝ=f  *  
*ẖnmw-Rʿ nb sḫ.t  *  
  
^B^ The King of Upper and Lower Egypt,  
who arises from the lotus,  
luminous of eyes for gods and people,  
who scintillates their skin,  
and pleases their hearts,  
so everybody rejoices to see him:  
Khnum-Re Lord of the Field.  

</div>
